attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The road fund licence is unfair because it applies a charge on the motorist regardless of the motorist’s annual mileage.  It does not apply to visitors to our country who use our roads, people using un-taxed vehicles and also short term workers with vehicles registered in other EU countries.

How the tax could work. The tax is collected in the same way as VAT. It is collected at the fuel pumps. The rate could be in the region of 35p per gallon. This would equate to the same annual amount based on a motorist driving 12,000 miles per year with average fuel consumption

Fairness . The more you drive, the more you pay. 

Who would pay more? 
 High mileage road users, Continental visitors, Unnecessary usage. People with uneconomical vehicles.

Who would pay less?  
People with low mileage usage such as pensioners, unemployed, 

Exemptions.
Because it’s a separate measurable tax, relief can be given to special vehicles, disabled driver etc.

Reduces the need for congestion charges.

rejection.details:
There are several petitions on this issue already. Please consider signing one of those, rather than creating another.
